alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cheshire County through 330 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms over Warwick, or 8 miles northwest of Orange, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall and wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Expect the development of ponding on roadways. Locations impacted include... Keene, Jaffrey, Peterborough, Winchester, Antrim, Dublin, Richmond, Harrisville, Nelson, Gilsum, Marlborough, Rindge, Swanzey, Hinsdale, Roxbury, Fitzwilliam, Troy, Sullivan, Chesterfield and Surry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern New Hampshire.
